definitions.definition: Not transitive : not having, or not taking, a direct object .
examples: The word "drink" is a transitive verb in "they drink wine", but an intransitive one in "they drink often."

definitions.definition: Not transitive or passing further; kept; detained.

Of a set of dice : containing three dice A, B, and C, with the property that A rolls higher than B more than half the time, and B rolls higher than C more than half the time, but lacking the property that A rolls higher than C more than half the time. See intransitive dice and intransitive game .

main_definition: ( grammar , of a verb ) Not transitive : not having, or not taking, a direct object .
secondary_definitions: ( rare ) Not transitive or passing further; kept; detained.

( probability ) Of a set of dice : containing three dice A, B, and C, with the property that A rolls higher than B more than half the time, and B rolls higher than C more than half the time, but lacking the property that A rolls higher than C more than half the time. See intransitive dice and intransitive game .
